body_html:
Hey @ChaoYue0307,

it is (normally) possible to build PyTorch from source using CUDA10. At least with my GTX 1070 and P5000 it is working fine. I cannot give any guides for the RTX series, but that should not be any different. Just install CUDA10 and Cudnn for it and follow the guide in https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch#from-source and install magma-cuda92 :)

Hope this helps and cheers,

Jendrik

Thanks a lot and I will check!
